basics.name: Benjamin Russ
basics.label: Mechanical/Mechatronics Engineer and Robotics Researcher
basics.summary: Mechanical Engineer and Robotics Researcher passionate about building responsive, force-aware robotic platforms. From academic research on multi-robot emergent behavior to industrial systems engineering at Honeywell, I integrate mechanical design with low-level control systems to enable adaptive, real-world robot performance. My experience in hardware, embedded control, and simulation allows me to develop and validate robust robotic platforms that shorten iteration cycles

work.name: Honeywell Intelligrated
work.summary: My current position which I am responsible for the design and implementation of preventative maintenance devices and the deployment of high value industrial systems.
highlights: Filed three patent applications relating to sensorized mechanical subsystems for automation
Concepted, prototyped, and finalized embedded design of preventative maintenance devices establishing an estimated \$100,000 annual revenue pipeline
Designed and executed customer specified testing contributing to a \$125M initial contract and established future order pipeline

work.name: Embodied and Interactive Systems Laboratory
work.summary: During my time and research with the EIS laboratory I developed a multi-robot Gazebo simulation within the ROS framework and replicated physical prototype.
highlights: Created Gazebo simulation in ROS to model swarm behavior and impedance control strategies
Designed and manufactured force sensing, omnidirectional robot platform for real-world validation
Developed real-time data pipelines in ROS for multi-sensor input (Load Cell, IMU) and physical actuation
Co-authored conference submission (IROS 2023) on impedance-controlled multi-robot interaction; revisions underway for resubmission

work.name: Honeywell Intelligrated
work.summary: This term was the second rotation which I was able to be on-site and assisting day to day developments compared to my first rotation. Some of my contributions included building next generation sortation products and supporting manufacturing.
highlights: Executed part revisions and FEA analysis for production validation
Developed prototype test stands and testing for transitioning to production environment

work.name: Honeywell Intelligrated
work.summary: This was my first internship rotation with honeywell during the onset of the covid pandemic. I was able to contribute to many projects, including a globalization effort for the shoe sorter product line.
highlights: Executed part revisions and FEA analysis for production validation
Supported globalization effort for shoe sorter to meet strict EU compliance guidelines

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Graduate Research Fellow
awards.awarder: Space Research Institute for Discovery and Exploration
awards.summary: This fellowship provided me the opportunity to reach great depth and complete many of the desired outcomes such as a full simulation and fully built prototype force sensitive robot. I am greatly honored for this recognition and opportunities it has provided.
